data.title: Simple Webshop
data.description: Developed a simple Webshop as a college assignment. Frontend was made using Angular 8 and AdminLTE free Bootstrap template. Backend was made using PHP Laravel and MySQL.
data.longDescription: As part of a challenging college assignment, I successfully developed a dynamic and user-friendly webshop, showcasing my proficiency in both frontend and backend technologies. Leveraging the power of Angular 8, I crafted an engaging and responsive frontend, seamlessly integrating the AdminLTE free Bootstrap template for a polished and intuitive user interface. On the backend, I utilized the robust PHP Laravel framework coupled with a MySQL database, ensuring optimal performance and data management. This project not only highlighted my technical skills in web development but also demonstrated my ability to deliver comprehensive solutions that meet both design and functionality requirements. Through this hands-on experience, I gained valuable insights into the intricacies of full-stack development, setting a solid foundation for my journey in the world of web application design and implementation.
githubLinks: https://github.com/zeljko94/webshop-angular
https://github.com/zeljko94/webshop-rest

data.title: LinguApp
data.description: Developed a user-friendly web application for efficiently booking classrooms within a language learning agency.
data.longDescription: Designed and developed a comprehensive web application as a solution to streamline the classroom booking process within a dynamic language learning agency. The primary objective of the application was to replace the manual and potentially error-prone scheduling method previously handled through a shared Google Docs spreadsheet. The core functionality of the application revolves around a sophisticated calendar system. This calendar not only ensures the efficient allocation of classrooms but also prevents scheduling conflicts by providing a clear overview of which instructor is assigned to a particular classroom, during specific time slots, teaching a specific subject. This innovation eliminated the challenges associated with overlapping schedules. A user-friendly interface allows instructors to effortlessly add appointments to the calendar through a dedicated form. This intuitive approach significantly improved the user experience and reduced the time required to manage bookings. Beyond the calendar functionality, an extensive admin section was implemented, empowering administrators to manage various aspects of the system. This includes the addition and modification of skills, subjects, classrooms, levels, users, and more. Technologically, the backend was implemented using the robust PHP Laravel framework, ensuring a scalable and maintainable foundation. The frontend was developed with Angular 9, providing a responsive and interactive user interface. The use of Bootstrap 3 contributed to a modern and visually appealing design. The underlying MySQL database played a pivotal role in storing and retrieving data efficiently. This relational database management system ensured the integrity of the information, supporting the seamless operation of the application. In summary, this project not only modernized the classroom booking process but also enhanced organizational efficiency, accuracy, and user satisfaction within the language learning agency.
githubLinks: https://github.com/zeljko94/lingua-app
https://github.com/zeljko94/laravel-lingua-app-rest

data.title: FoodApp
data.description: Developed a seamless Android and desktop application for efficient food and drink ordering in a restaurant setting.
data.longDescription: created an android and desktop application for ordering drinks and food in a restaurant. The applications are implemented in such a way that on every table in the restaurant there is an android device with a running application on which we can choose food and drinks from the menu. After we select items from the menu, press the 'Order' button, the created order is sent to the desktop application located in the bar, and the restaurant staff can immediately see from which table and what was ordered. In addition to ordering the menu itself, the application also provides detailed business information. The desktop application was created using JavaFX, and the android application was created using the Java programming language and Android Studio, a MySQL database was used.
githubLinks: https://github.com/zeljko94/FoodAppAndroid
https://github.com/zeljko94/FoodAppDesktop

data.title: Hotel Room CMS from scratch using PHP
data.description: The purpose of this app was creating a MVC rest api from scracth using PHP. It's a very simple app that lets users browse the rooms inside of a hotel and place orders.
data.longDescription: Embarked on a comprehensive learning journey, I crafted an exemplary hotel reservation application as a pivotal college assignment, focusing on the meticulous creation of a robust MVC REST API from scratch using PHP, Bootstrap, and MySQL. The foundation of this project lies in the principled implementation of the MVC architecture, a fundamental paradigm in web development. With PHP as the driving force behind the backend, the application seamlessly weaves together the Model, View, and Controller components, illustrating a deep understanding of software design principles. The frontend, adorned with a modern and intuitive Bootstrap-based interface, ensures a delightful user experience. Through this application, users can effortlessly explore hotel rooms, gaining insights into features, availability, and pricing, all while adhering to the MVC structure. The reservation system, a cornerstone of the application, empowers users to make bookings with ease. The MySQL database, meticulously integrated into the architecture, serves as a reliable repository for storing and retrieving reservation details, highlighting the importance of robust data management. This project not only demonstrates mastery over MVC architecture but also underscores the commitment to continuous learning and the application of theoretical knowledge in a real-world context. Crafting this MVC REST API from scratch serves as a testament to the dedication to excellence in software engineering education.
githubLinks: https://github.com/zeljko94/Hotel_Room_CMS

data.title: Quiz app
data.description: A simple quiz app - college assignment
data.longDescription: Created a simple quiz app. In the application, it is possible to create quizzes and questions together with the offered answers and an indicator that is the correct answer to that question. When we create a new quiz, we can attach questions that we created earlier to it. It also contains a screen for starting the quiz and displaying the results. The application was created as a college assignment for the purpose of learning the Rest API and the Angular framework.

data.title: FAHP (Fuzzy Analytic Hierarchy Process) - Moodle plugin
data.description: This application was created for the purpose of a thesis for my master's degree. The application enables input of N criteria and relationships between these criteria and does FAHP on the input data.
data.longDescription: Developed as a pivotal component for my master's thesis, this application serves a crucial role in streamlining the intricate process of evaluating and assigning weights to multiple criteria. The application's core functionality revolves around the dynamic input of N criteria and the establishment of nuanced relationships between them. These relationships are articulated through a linguistic scale, allowing users to express degrees of relevance or dominance between criteria with precision. At the heart of the system is the utilization of the Fuzzy Analytic Hierarchy Process (FAHP) method for calculating weight values. This method, renowned for its ability to handle imprecise and uncertain information, provides a robust foundation for deriving scalar numbers that represent the relative importance of each entered criterion. The FAHP method enhances the accuracy and reliability of the weight values, contributing to a more nuanced and informed decision-making process. Implemented as a Moodle plugin, the application seamlessly integrates into the Moodle e-learning platform, harnessing the capabilities of PHP, JavaScript, and jQuery. This integration ensures a user-friendly and interactive experience, making complex analytical tasks accessible within the educational context. As both a practical implementation of theoretical concepts and a valuable tool for decision-makers, this application stands as a testament to the fusion of academic knowledge and real-world application in the realm of multi-criteria decision analysis.
githubLinks: https://github.com/zeljko94/fahp-moodle-plugin

data.title: Text detection in scene images
data.description: Crafted as a robust text detection script, this project showcases an efficient and versatile tool for extracting textual information from images. Leveraging the OpenCV library and a pre-trained EAST (Efficient and Accurate Scene Text) detector model, the script seamlessly detects and highlights text regions in images.
data.longDescription: This comprehensive text detection script, demonstrates proficiency in computer vision and image processing. Developed using Python and the OpenCV library, the script employs a pre-trained EAST (Efficient and Accurate Scene Text) detector model to dynamically process images, adeptly adjusting dimensions for optimal performance. Key features include the implementation of Non-Maximum Suppression (NMS) techniques—Felzenszwalb, FAST, and Malisiewicz algorithms—for precise text localization. The script goes beyond mere detection, visually enhancing results by drawing bounding boxes and polygons around identified text regions. Notably, its user-friendly interface allows for parameter customization, including confidence thresholds and image dimensions. Designed as a Moodle plugin, the script seamlessly integrates into the e-learning platform, showcasing adaptability and usability in educational contexts. This project encapsulates a robust technological stack and highlights practical implementation skills, making it a valuable asset that underscores the ability to create impactful solutions for real-world challenges.
githubLinks: https://github.com/zeljko94/text-detection-scene-image

data.title: Python chat application
data.description: The chat application, developed as a bachelor's degree assignment in Python, comprises a server and client components, facilitating real-time communication.
data.longDescription: This Python-based chat application, developed for a bachelor's degree assignment, features a server with a Tkinter GUI. The server initiates a TCP connection, manages connected clients using a threaded approach, and facilitates real-time communication. The GUI includes components for public chat, user input, and a list of online users. The server intelligently handles public and private messages, client connections, and disconnections. With a modular structure, adherence to coding standards, and clear documentation, this project showcases proficiency in networking, threading, and GUI development.
githubLinks: https://github.com/zeljko94/python_chat_application
